title: Multi Owner NFT's
description: Athletes and schools don't have an easy way to share video content rights. Can multi owner NFT's support new revenue for the both?

f6_assessments.q0: Great idea! An excellent response to the challenge to provide a massive onramp to the Cardano ecosystem. Starting with the specific use case of athletes via university and beyond increases its chance of success and reduces unknown obstacles. This narrow focus also meets the challenge criteria of framing towards specific use-cases. That the smart contracts used for all the magic making will be open sourced will further enable more more niche implementations by toolmakers in the community to solve a wide range of problems. Falls short of a five start because it's not clear whether the proposal is trying to build a smart contract template (a developer tool) or implement or validate a particular business model.
f6_assessments.q1:
Creating multi-owner NFT smart contracts that allow for long term royalties to original creators is very achievable and something the ecosystem needs. 

An important questions that should have been answered: Will the users own the NFT directly or will their ownership be document or proxied by the smart contract? 

Since the proposal is title "Multi Owner NFT" and much of the spirit of crypto is self custody, I'm interpreting the intention to mean users will own their NFT directly in their wallets.  Under this assumption, the proposal fails to demonstrate a clear plan for adoption that include wallet vendors neither does it propose to build its own wallet. 

Daedalus, Yoroi, and AdaLite (the lion share of how self-custodying ada holders transact) do not support multi-sig transactions or smart contract interactions. Perhaps they might in the near future and the team behind proposal might have privilege information, but it's not clear how exactly user will interface, own, and transact.The proposal fails to provide onboarding details for users. Perhaps the intention is hidden with the "Stakeholder behavior research?" It's not clear.

If we take the face value of the proposal's point that "The focus for this funding is to create Smart Contract Templates for other developers who want to create multi-owner NFT's" then it should have been in the Developer tools challenge. This focus is not a business model with NFT usage as a core component that can act as an onramp to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a solid timeline. Actual KPIs or measurable outputs that can be audited however is a bit lacking. "Onboarding 2-3 more Plutus Pioneer Devs from the community" does not speak towards any measurable output.
stakeholder behavior templates, git repos, town hall updates  however all lends themselves well to audits. 2 stars because these KPIs do not support the challenge goal of proposing business models that drive business use cases on Cardano that have NFT usage as a core component that can act as an onramp to the Cardano ecosystem. The KPI defined in the proposal move away from validating a business model and more toward validating a developer tool. A good business model KPI perhaps would be if www.quicc.io can get some its current athletes sign to some Multi Owner NFT's.

f6_assessments.q0: In my understanding from your problem statement and solution, you are trying to tokenize school athletes media copyrights and create tools like smart contract templates to make it simpler for users to create a multi-owner copyright NFT am i correct? In my opinion, the proposal matches the objectives of the challenge. It will give a new means on use case for NFT. However, this proposal did not mention on how can the copyright protection be enforced on other countries since all country still doesn't recognize you. And also how will it be scale from 15 schools to multiple school across the globe.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer will likely to execute the project, however they fail to present in details on how the money is spent. What is the cost of manpower per hour? What are the resources used and how much it costs? The requested funds are almost half of the total funding so there must be details on how the money will be spent. Also there is no plan provided if there is additional funding required. A proper breakdown of the budget is needed. Another point is to better provide verifiable credentials of the team members to be more transparent so that the community will know that you have a proper team that is able to carry out the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has given a roadmap with clear definition of success. However there is no github link or any information posted to keep track of progress.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is to develop smart contract templates to enable dual ownership of NFT's. For me, the proposal should have been filed under "Developer Ecosystem" not "NFT Business Models" because the proposal does not have NFTs at the core of the business model.
f6_assessments.q1: The team provided a link to a website, but I feel the proposal requires further development to ensure successful implementation. I would like to see links to LinkedIn or similar to provide additional detail/evidence about the team work history, education and past experiences. I would like the team to expand on the responsibilities and deliverables of each member, this allows the team to judge whether there is a work overload in one area. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed".
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a minimal roadmap and budget. I would like to see the team develop Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) for the project (interview 3 schools by month 1, interview 8 schools by month 2), and connect the KPIs to milestones on the project roadmap (timeline). I would like to see the team create a solid roadmap -  develop and add milestones to provide deeper detail, set technical development milestones for creating the product. I would like to see the budget developed beyond a single line entry and broken down into monthly spending, and I would like the team to connect the KPI's and roadmap milestones to the spending, what are the specific tasks and deliverables that the labor must provide and when must they deliver the tasks – this breakdown will give a clearer indication about the implementation workload feasibility and match the deliverables to the spending - thus the team can track performance and spending over a timeline. As the project stands at the moment, I feel the project will be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is well written and has identified a suitable problem that has the potential to add value to the Cardano ecosystem via smart contracts and NFT's. There is enough detail in the proposal to suggest that scaling the project in the future is achievable and I like the modular aspect the team talks about in the design phase. The team is focussing on athletes at this stage but I could see this being useful to musicians, photographers, plus a host of additional sectors where historical footage is useful in the present.
f6_assessments.q1: The team have high quality experience evidenced in the linked website and this suggests they have viable experience with growing a business from start up. I do note that the team will need to employ additional developer resources which at the time of writing does not appear to have happened. This does pose a risk in terms of implementation and budgeting. Having said that the plan appears quite straightforward and a breakdown of costs is loosely provided. The big factor in this teams favour will be the integration of their present enterprise quicc acting as a gateway for potential clients for themselves as well as the potential for further developer involvement once the smart contract modules are created.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is first class as is the presentation of the quicc website which bodes well for the professionalism of this team. The metrics/KPI's seem deliverable and reasonable. I do have some questions regarding a breakdown of royalties once the smart contracts are created but expect these details are still to be negotiated. Some indication of this however, may have provided greater assurance of the actual value to the Cardano community for the funds requested.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer presents a market segment which is set up for growth as now students-athletes in US can accept funds from third parties.
Solving the problem of funding students and growing the school prestige via NFTs, granting both the right of the video property is a valuable idea that could prove the multi-ownership NFT functionality on Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
I see a first challenge in finding out the right Plutus pioneer developers, however, however, the proposer is well experienced in the video editing sector, as it's proven by the startup Quicc he linked, which already deals with video for students and pro athletes. Moreover, there is already the commitment of some universities and pro athletes to deal with NFTs.
This model, anyhow would not be applicable in many universities worldwide, as not every country is integrating sport so deeply in their colleges, especially in Europe.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is well defined as the proposers sets the 3, 6, 12 months objectives in a clear and concise way. However, a breakout of the budget would have helped to understand the fund allocation. Given the estimation of the amount of hours (540), I see that the hourly rate of 150 $/h for this job is a bit overrated. I'd redefine the funds to 70000 $.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer makes a convincing argument that in light of current legal changes in the United States, multi-owner NFTs for school athletics are a legitimate NFT business model. The drawback is that at 81k USD requested, this proposal would use more than half of the funds in the challenge.  This seems excessive for what is a research project and set of smart contract templates.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer already has a successful startup managing video content including school athletics libraries. No specific smart-contract experience is listed (besides working through plutus pioneers). It would be nice to see someone with more SC experience involved in the project.
f6_assessments.q2: A detailed set of measurables is offered and the proposed timeline seems realistic.

solution: Build multi-owner NFT smart contracts that allow for long term royalties to original creators, build collectible value, & grow school brand.
experience: I have spent 10 years as a technical founder and our startup, Quicc, manages large media libraries for schools, students, & pro athletes.
